Clients recommend us and come back.

MainSkills.description: Our company is recognized as one of the leading players in the certification market in the Russian Federation and the countries of the Eurasian Economic Union. NVSERT specialists provide a wide range of services focused on mandatory and voluntary certification, declarations, compliance with technical regulations and other documents confirming product quality.

items.title: Construction materials
items.text: All construction materials must comply with safety, environmental, and strength requirements. Certification includes laboratory tests confirming resistance to loads, moisture, fire and other external factors. Without a certificate, it is impossible to sell cement, bricks, double-glazed units, insulation panels and other construction materials in Russia and the Customs Union countries. Special attention is paid to materials used in residential premises, since they must be safe for human health. Obtaining permits helps avoid claims from regulators and confirms compliance with modern quality standards.

items.title: Children’s goods and toys
items.text: Toys and children’s products must meet high quality and safety standards, as they are intended for the most vulnerable consumers — children. Certification includes comprehensive laboratory testing aimed at detecting toxic substances, checking mechanical strength, fire safety and the presence of small parts that may be hazardous. Products that come into contact with a child’s skin or mucous membranes (for example, pacifiers, bottles, rattles) undergo additional tests for hypoallergenicity and sanitary requirements. Only after successful completion of all checks a document confirming compliance is issued.

items.title: Food products
items.text: Food products must comply with sanitary standards and pass mandatory certification. Laboratory tests verify composition, the presence of harmful additives, shelf life and production conditions. Additional requirements apply to products containing allergens, supplements and GMOs. Certification also confirms compliance with food safety standards, which is important for both manufacturers and consumers. Without the required documents, production and sale are prohibited, and violations may lead to serious fines and product recalls.

items.title: Beverages
items.text: Beverages such as juices, water, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks are subject to mandatory certification to confirm their safety and compliance with quality standards. During certification, components, storage conditions and packaging are checked to prevent possible adverse effects on consumers’ health. It is important that beverages do not contain prohibited substances, such as excessive preservatives, chemical additives or allergens. Without an appropriate certificate, selling beverages on the market is not possible.

items.title: Furniture
items.text: Furniture products, including wardrobes, beds, tables and other interior items, are subject to mandatory certification. This process confirms compliance with safety requirements, environmental standards and quality norms. Laboratory tests check the durability of materials, the toxicity of coatings and other important characteristics. Only after successful completion of all stages a certificate or declaration of conformity is issued. Without this document it is prohibited to manufacture, import or sell furniture in Russia and the Customs Union countries. Especially strict requirements apply to children’s furniture and products that may contain potentially harmful components.

items.title: Lubricants
items.text: Lubricants, oils and technical fluids must comply with strict regulations governing their composition, viscosity, resistance to extreme temperatures and other important properties. Certification includes laboratory tests that determine chemical composition, toxicity level and environmental impact. Depending on the field of application — industrial equipment, cars or aviation — certification requirements can differ significantly. Obtaining a certificate or declaration of conformity allows manufacturers and importers to legally sell their products in Russia and the Customs Union countries.

items.title: Light industry
items.text: Light industry goods, including clothing, footwear, textiles and other products, are subject to mandatory certification. The certification process includes checking compliance with sanitary and environmental standards, as well as testing the safety of materials used in production. For children’s goods, safety requirements are particularly strict. Without confirmation of compliance, selling such goods is not permitted.

items.title: Household chemicals
items.text: Detergents, disinfectants and household chemicals require certification to confirm safe use. Without these documents, sales are not allowed. It is important that chemicals do not contain dangerous components such as carcinogens or toxic substances that may harm health. Products that come into contact with food or are intended for children undergo stricter checks.

items.title: Low-voltage equipment
items.text: Low-voltage equipment, including transformers, electrical panels, contactors and other devices, is subject to mandatory certification to confirm safety and compliance with established standards. Certification includes testing electrical safety, durability and resistance to environmental factors such as temperature and humidity. This is a prerequisite for selling products on the Russian market. Without certification, low-voltage equipment cannot be sold or used in Russian institutions.

items.title: Network equipment
items.text: Network equipment, including routers, switches and cables, is also subject to mandatory certification to confirm compliance with safety and quality standards. It is important that equipment meets electromagnetic compatibility requirements and does not interfere with other devices. Certification includes checks for durability, energy efficiency and functionality. Without certification, selling network equipment in Russia is not permitted.

items.title: Industrial equipment
items.text: Industrial equipment must comply with strict safety and quality regulations. During certification, all aspects of equipment operation are checked, including resistance to loads, electrical safety, environmental impact and compliance with energy efficiency standards. Certification confirms that equipment meets the requirements for use across industries such as mechanical engineering, metallurgy and petrochemicals.

items.title: Packaging
items.text: Any packaging products, including cardboard boxes, plastic containers and glass bottles, must comply with established safety and environmental requirements. During certification, packaging is tested for strength, resistance to external influences and safety of materials in contact with food. This is especially important for the food, pharmaceutical and cosmetic industries, where packaging is key to preserving product quality. In addition to compliance, packaging must meet disposal and recycling requirements, increasing trust from consumers and regulators.

items.title: Household goods
items.text: Products for home and household needs include a wide range of goods, from household appliances to cleaning products, and require mandatory certification. Certification guarantees that products are safe to use, do not contain toxic substances and comply with established quality standards. Laboratory tests analyze materials, durability and resistance to moisture, temperature and mechanical loads. Goods that come into contact with food or are intended for children undergo additional tests. This is a mandatory requirement for both manufacturers and importers who want to sell products in Russia and the Customs Union countries.

items.title: Stationery
items.text: Stationery products, including paper, pens, glue and school supplies, must comply with established quality and safety standards. Certification checks for toxic substances, material stability and product durability. Goods intended for children undergo additional tests confirming safety during long-term use. Without the required documents, selling stationery on the Russian market is not permitted.

items.title: Cosmetics and hygiene products
items.text: Cosmetics and hygiene products are subject to mandatory quality control because they directly contact human skin and mucous membranes. Certification checks composition, toxic and allergenic substances, pH level, microbiological purity and the effectiveness of claimed properties. Products intended for children and people with sensitive skin undergo additional tests. Without certification, selling cosmetics and hygiene products is not permitted, and non-compliance may lead to product recalls and financial penalties.

items.title: Pet products
items.text: Pet products, including food, toys and accessories, are also subject to certification to confirm safety. Certification checks the composition and nutritional value of pet food, the presence of prohibited or harmful additives, and the safety of toys and accessories. This is a prerequisite for import and sale in Russia and the Customs Union countries. Non-compliance may lead to product withdrawal from the market and financial sanctions.

items.title: Medical devices
items.text: Medical devices are subject to mandatory certification to confirm safety, effectiveness and compliance with established standards. This applies to diagnostic and surgical equipment as well as consumables such as syringes, bandages and catheters. Laboratory tests check sterility, resistance to external influences, device accuracy and possible impact on human health. Depending on the type of device, certification may follow different schemes and include additional clinical tests. Only after obtaining the relevant document products can be manufactured, sold and used in medical institutions.

items.title: Personal protective equipment
items.text: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is a key element of ensuring worker safety in manufacturing, construction and other areas. Products such as gloves, helmets, safety glasses and workwear must pass certification to confirm effectiveness and compliance with sanitary standards. Certification includes testing material strength, usability and protective properties.

items.title: Transport and special machinery
items.text: Vehicles and special machinery are subject to mandatory certification to confirm compliance with safety, efficiency and environmental standards. Certification checks mechanical characteristics, system safety and performance. Products are also tested for compliance with environmental standards, including emissions.

items.title: High-voltage equipment
items.text: High-voltage equipment is subject to mandatory certification to confirm safety, effectiveness and durability. Products are tested for compliance with safety standards, electromagnetic compatibility and energy efficiency. Without certification, high-voltage equipment cannot be used in industry, energy and other areas requiring high reliability.

items.title: Services
items.text: Certain types of services, such as medical, educational and construction services, are subject to mandatory certification. This confirms compliance with established quality standards, staff qualifications and safety requirements. Service certification is needed to increase customer trust and protect their rights. For example, medical institutions must have licenses and certificates confirming staff qualifications and compliance of equipment with sanitary norms.

Customs declaration with customs stamp (if shipped)
Packing list with number of packages, packaging type, gross/net weight (per item and total)

items.title: How does product certification work?
items.text: Product certification is the process of confirming that a product complies with established safety, quality and technical regulations. It starts with submitting an application to an accredited body. The applicant provides a set of documents: technical specifications (if available), instructions, product description, contract, labels and more. The certification body then sends product samples to an accredited laboratory for testing. Based on test reports, a conformity decision is made. In some cases, an additional production inspection is conducted. After all stages, a certificate of conformity is issued, registered in the state register and provided to the applicant. Without such a document, products cannot be legally sold in Russia or the EAEU countries if they are included in the mandatory certification list.

items.title: Where to start importing goods?
items.text: Import starts with legal and logistics preparation. The first step is to determine the TN VED code of the product. It defines whether certification, registration, sanitary documents, permits or other controls are required. Next, a contract with the foreign supplier is prepared, along with an invoice and packing list. If required, certification documents are submitted so that permits are available by the time of import. Then shipment is arranged and the goods pass customs clearance at the border. The declarant provides all necessary documents, including certificates or declarations of conformity. Without them, goods may not be released into circulation. The importer must consider risks: incorrect codes, document errors or border delays can lead to fines and downtime. It is recommended to consult logistics and certification specialists at the preparation stage.

items.title: Where to start launching production?
items.text: Launching production is a complex process with several key stages. First is registering a legal entity and tax registration. Next is choosing an appropriate OKVED code and preparing technical documentation: TU (technical specifications), formulations, drawings and process charts. At this stage, it is also important to determine whether the product is subject to mandatory certification, declaration, registration or licensing. After that come selecting/setting up a production facility, purchasing equipment, hiring staff and tuning the production process. Even small batches must meet safety requirements; otherwise they cannot be legally sold. You should also consider logistics, packaging, labeling and legal risks. It is advisable to set up quality control before entering the market to avoid claims and fines.

items.title: Which goods require a GOST R certificate?
items.text: A GOST R certificate is required for products included in the mandatory certification list approved by the Government of the Russian Federation. It includes various product groups that may pose risks: electrical goods, household appliances, construction materials, cables, furniture, children’s goods, PPE, certain types of clothing, footwear and toys. The key criterion is potential risk to health and safety. If a product is not in the list, you can obtain a refusal letter or pass voluntary certification. Since the 2010s, most products have moved under Customs Union technical regulations, and GOST R remains only for goods not covered by CU TR. Always check the current list and consult specialists — mistakes may lead to fines and customs arrest.

items.title: What is the difference between a CU TR certificate and a CU TR declaration?
items.text: Both a certificate and a declaration of conformity to CU TR confirm that products meet the requirements of the Customs Union technical regulations. The main difference is the procedure and the level of responsibility. A certificate is issued through an accredited body: testing is performed by a third-party laboratory, everything is verified externally, and responsibility is shared between the body and the applicant. A declaration is registered by the applicant: they may use their own or third-party test reports, but the applicant bears full legal responsibility for the data. The form depends on the regulation list. In some cases both are allowed, and businesses often choose a declaration as it is cheaper and faster. However, liability for violations is higher for declarations, including administrative and criminal consequences.

items.title: What are the fines for an incorrect EAEU declaration?
items.text: Providing a false or invalid EAEU declaration is a serious offense. If it turns out that the product does not comply with the declared requirements, a company can be fined up to 1 million rubles under Article 14.43 of the Code of Administrative Offenses. Confiscation of goods, withdrawal of the declaration from the register, a ban on sales in the EAEU, and removal from marketplaces are also possible. Repeated violations may result in temporary suspension of activities. If consequences affected health or property, sanctions are stricter up to criminal liability. The applicant must store evidence (test reports, labeling samples, etc.) for 10 years. Any discrepancy between the declaration and reality (e.g., different manufacturer, composition or country) is a reason for inspection and fines.

items.title: Is certification required for custom-made goods?
items.text: Yes. A custom order does not exempt you from legal requirements if the product falls under mandatory certification or declaration. For example, custom clothing, made-to-order furniture or custom equipment still require documents if they are sold, supplied or exported. The only exception is goods used strictly for personal needs and not placed into circulation. This is especially relevant for marketplaces: without a declaration/certificate a product listing can be blocked. In some cases, TU may be required if there is no applicable GOST. Custom-made goods are subject to the same safety, labeling and packaging requirements as mass production — it is important to consider this from the start to avoid issues later.

items.title: What to do with inventory after a certificate expires?
items.text: If you have inventory in stock and the certificate/declaration has expired, it depends on the import/production date. By law, you may sell remaining stock if it was received before the document expired, provided you have supporting documents (invoices, acceptance acts, internal records). Such stock is considered legal. But if the product was received after expiration, selling it is a violation. In that case, fines, returns and suspension of activities are possible. The optimal solution is to re-issue a new certificate for the batch or register a separate declaration for the remaining stock. You can also temporarily pause sales and, if needed, repackage with updated labeling. This is especially important for marketplaces and offline retail under inspections.

items.title: Can one declaration cover multiple manufacturers?
items.text: No, not under standard rules. A declaration of conformity is registered for a specific manufacturer with its exact name, address and country. Even if products are identical, but made by different manufacturers, each requires its own set of documents. This is because each manufacturer bears individual responsibility for safety. An exception may be possible if manufacturers are within one group, use the same formulation and production lines and this is documented. In typical practice: one declaration = one manufacturer. Violations may lead to document annulment, fines and blocking at customs or online platforms.

items.title: Do I need to re-issue a certificate if the address changes?
items.text: Yes. Changing the legal address or the actual location of the manufacturer requires re-issuing a certificate or declaration. By law, conformity documents must contain accurate information about the applicant and manufacturer. If the address changes (e.g., a new workshop, relocation to another region/country), the document becomes invalid. This applies to both Russian and foreign manufacturers. If a mismatch is found during an inspection, the products may be considered illegal. To avoid sanctions, you must either apply for amendments (if allowed) or register a new document. Labeling, packaging and accompanying documents must also be updated.

items.title: Can I list multiple goods in one refusal letter?
items.text: Yes, but only under certain conditions. One refusal letter can include multiple goods if they belong to one product group, fall under the same classifier section and are not subject to mandatory certification or declaration. All TN VED codes must be correct, with product descriptions and a reference to the regulation confirming that certification is not required. Such a document is often requested for customs clearance or marketplaces. However, if goods differ significantly by purpose/composition or belong to different groups, it is recommended to issue separate refusal letters to avoid misunderstandings and additional requests. The more precise the wording, the lower the risks.

items.subtitle: Fixed price
items.text: After signing the contract, the price will not change.

items.subtitle: Free adjustments
items.text: Until the documents are fully approved, we make all necessary changes at no additional cost.

items.subtitle: Money-back
items.text: If certification is impossible or there is an issue, we will resolve it or refund your payment.

items.subtitle: Compliance with all standards
items.text: Certification is carried out in full compliance with Russian state standards.

items.subtitle: Official documentation
items.text: All certificates are issued legitimately and registered in official state registries.

items.subtitle: Personal data protection
items.text: We guarantee confidentiality and reliable protection of your data.

items.subtitle: Strict deadlines
items.text: We guarantee completion of all work on time.

items.subtitle: Express document certification
items.text: Urgent processing so you can enter the market as quickly as possible.

items.subtitle: Personal manager
items.text: A specialist who will support you at every stage.

items.subtitle: Re-issuing documents
items.text: We extend documents issued by other companies — without risks or non-compliance.

items.subtitle: Preparation for re-certification
items.text: We will remind you about deadlines in advance, check your documents, and prepare missing ones.

items.subtitle: Free consultations
items.text: We will explain all stages of obtaining permit documentation in detail.

page.title: Letters of appreciation
page.introText1: In modern business, the reliability of a partner plays a key role. Companies choose those who can ensure stability, quality and strict compliance with requirements.
page.introText2: Over the years, the Certification Center has proven itself as a reliable partner in certification and standardization. Our clients—industrial enterprises, manufacturing companies, trading organizations and public institutions—note professionalism, efficiency and careful attention to their needs.
